text: Here's how to connect your PS4 controller
to your iPhone.

In this video, we'll
cover four quick steps
to get your controller connected.
To get started,
take your PS4 controller and hold down

the "PS" and "SHARE"
buttons at the same time.

Once the back light on the
controller starts flashing,
you can let go.
With the controller in pairing mode,
navigate to settings on your iPhone.

Click the Bluetooth tab
and make sure it's enabled.
If not, press the slider to turn it on.

With Bluetooth on and the
controller in pairing mode,
"DUALSHOCK 4" should appear below
in the available devices.
Tap on it to connect.

Wait a moment, and the
controller should confirm

that it is connected and
appear under "MY DEVICES."

Your PS4 controller is now
all set to game on iPhone.

Go to the app store or
check out Apple Arcade

to find some games that
support controllers.
